Issues.Title: provide a 'DateValueAccessor' for input[type=date]
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

forms

### Description

Currently, we have a specialized [NumberValueAccessor](https://angular.io/api/forms/NumberValueAccessor) that can be used to bind FormControls with `input[type=date]`.


### Proposed solution

It would be nice if we could have a `DateValueAccessor` that supported `input[type=date]`. Would be extra nice if we could also get similar accessors for `input[type=datetime-local]`, `input[type=time]`, `input[type=month]`  and others, though it's understandable if these are lower priority given that Firefox doesn't support them properly. With the `Temporal` api on the horizon, I feel like this is specially important.

### Alternatives considered

simply treating date inputs as string is definitely doable. Implementing the directive [ourselves](https://coryrylan.com/blog/using-html5-date-input-with-date-objects-and-angular) could also be a solution; this issue is mostly because I feel like this is warranted to be part of baseline Angular.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "provide a 'DateValueAccessor' for input[type=date]" (#48286)

Issues.Title: DI works differenty for the local @Injectable() class and provided by a library (same code)
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

When Injectable() Service is provided by a library, published to npm (following [the docs](https://angular.io/guide/creating-libraries)), it can not be used without a constructor:

```
error NG2016: The injectable PaintingsCollection inherits its constructor from CollectionService, but the latter has a constructor parameter that is not compatible with dependency injection. Either add an explicit constructor to PaintingsCollection or change CollectionService's constructor to use parameters that are valid for DI.

6 export class PaintingsCollection extends CollectionService<Painting> {
               ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~




‚úñ Failed to compile.
```

But if you copy the source code to your project, and import the same class:
```
‚úî Compiled successfully.
```

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/ngx-collection-example-23jubz?file=src%2Fapp%2Fcollections%2Fpaintings.collection.ts

1) [class is provided by the library](https://stackblitz.com/edit/ngx-collection-example-23jubz?file=src%2Fapp%2Fcollections%2Fpaintings.collection.ts) - error ‚ö†Ô∏è
2) [same code, copy-pasted and imported locally](https://stackblitz.com/edit/ngx-collection-example-rkqbbw?file=src%2Fapp%2Fcollections%2Fpaintings.collection.ts) - works fine ‚úÖ

Issues.Title: build: hide `--loader` warning when ESM import patch is installed
Issues.Body:
Similar to the Rules NodeJS require patch, we have an ESM import patch as of the AIO Bazel migration (to support ESM scripts better).

This script uses `--loader`, an experimental NodeJS flag. This is similar to how `ts-node` uses it. We should disable the warnings as it results in a lot of unreadable Bazel output and the warnings are okay to be ignored. Note that we cannot fine-grain disable the specific warning so all others would be disabled too.

Realistically we haven't seen any in the past and long-term we will be not relying on patched resolution anyway (looking at `rules_js`).

Issues.Title: refactor(core): remove debug data structures
Issues.Body: This commit removes several debug data structures from the framework runtime. The data structures in question were introduced in the framework in the past with the idea of having debugging aid in the form of the human-redable data structures. It turned out that in practice those data structures were not used (most of the fwk developers didn't even know about their existence!), yet we kept paying the price of maintaining those duplicated (prod and debug) version of the data structures.

Issues.Title: Support IANA time zone for date formatting
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

This was once requested #40865 but is now locked due to inactivity. I want to raise this again because IMO supporting `IANA` timezone names natively is a huge improvement, especially now when you can set the default timezone (which is actually an UTC offset, not a timezone) through [`DATE_PIPE_DEFAULT_OPTIONS`](https://angular.io/api/common/DATE_PIPE_DEFAULT_OPTIONS) token.

Why supporting `IANA` is such a big deal? Because of [Daylight Saving Time (DST)](https://www.timeanddate.com/time/dst/statistics.html). 
Countries that are using DST does not have a fixed UTC offset, it depends on the season.
So setting a default timezone (which is an UTC offset) through `DATE_PIPE_DEFAULT_OPTIONS` does not bring that much value today, it's even hard to think of a use case for this. For applications that let the user to set their preferred timezone in settings this token can't be utilized, you're still forced to come up with workaroundish solutions like creating a custom date pipe.

This is a default behaviour when timezone is not provided:

```html
<!-- 
Browser timezone: Europe/Vilnius
DATE_PIPE_DEFAULT_OPTIONS: not provided
-->

{{ '2022-10-29T05:00:00.000Z' | date: 'full' }} // Thursday, 29 October 2022 at 08:00:00 GMT+03:00 ‚úÖ 
{{ '2022-10-31T06:00:00.000Z' | date: 'full' }} // Thursday, 31 October 2022 at 08:00:00 GMT+02:00 ‚úÖ 
<!-- As you can see DST is handled flawlessly. -->
```

Now imagine we want to format all dates the same for all the users not matter on what timezone they are (maybe it's a company timezone, whatever). What `DATE_PIPE_DEFAULT_OPTIONS` value has to be provided for this to work? `UTC+2` or `UTC+3` (in case of `Europe/Vilnius` tz)? You see, you can't choose one, both are needed depending on the date you're trying to format.

```html
<!-- 
Browser timezone: Europe/Stockholm (does not matter, can be any tz)
DATE_PIPE_DEFAULT_OPTIONS: { timezone: 'UTC+2' }
-->

{{ '2022-10-29T05:00:00.000Z' | date: 'full' }} // Thursday, 29 October 2022 at 07:00:00 GMT+02:00 ‚ùå 
{{ '2022-10-31T06:00:00.000Z' | date: 'full' }} // Thursday, 31 October 2022 at 08:00:00 GMT+02:00 ‚úÖ 
```

```html
<!-- 
Browser timezone: Europe/Stockholm (does not matter, can be any tz)
DATE_PIPE_DEFAULT_OPTIONS: { timezone: 'UTC+3' }
-->

{{ '2022-10-29T05:00:00.000Z' | date: 'full' }} // Thursday, 29 October 2022 at 08:00:00 GMT+03:00 ‚úÖ 
{{ '2022-10-31T06:00:00.000Z' | date: 'full' }} // Thursday, 31 October 2022 at 09:00:00 GMT+03:00 ‚ùå 
```


### Proposed solution

Add support for [`IANA`](https://www.iana.org/time-zones) time zone name in all these APIs:

https://angular.io/api/common/DATE_PIPE_DEFAULT_OPTIONS
```
{ provide: DATE_PIPE_DEFAULT_OPTIONS, useValue: { timezone: 'Europe/Vilnius' } }
```

https://angular.io/api/common/formatDate
```
{{ myDate | date: 'full':'Europe/Vilnius' }}
```

https://angular.io/api/common/DatePipe
```ts
formatDate(myDate, 'full', 'Europe/Vilnius');
```



### Alternatives considered

If for some reason `IANA` time zone support is **not** considered to be implemented now or in the future then I would suggest renaming the `timezone` property to `utcOffset` which would be more accurate and less confusing for developers.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Support IANA time zone for date formatting" (#48279)

Issues.Title: SVG Elements wrapped in Component not focusable using tabindex
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

common, core, forms

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

I am trying to make use of the default behaviour when a user presses Tab to iterate over input elements.

I want to make SVG elements focusable by key stroke. The SVG is wrapped inside a component.

```
<parent-component>        
  <input>
  <child-component></child-component>
  <input>
</parent-component>
```

child-component.html

```
<svg>
  <g (click)='doSomething' tabindex='0' focusable='true'></g>
</svg>
```

Can't make it work with tabindex or focusable tho.

I am logging the active/focused element like this

```
@HostListener('document:keydown.tab', ['$event'])
  omitFocusedElement(e: KeyboardEvent) {
    console.log(document.activeElement)    
  }
```

Tabbing order breaks and the element before the nested svg keeps the focus, tabbing does not go any further then

So instead, I tried something else

```
<parent-component>
  <input>
  <svg>
    <g (click)='doSomething' tabindex='0'></g>
  </svg>
  <input>
</parent-component>
```

When the svg is not contained by a component, it becomes focusable.

But I need to make it work, when a svg is wrapped by a component.

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 13.3.5
Node: 14.16.0
Package Manager: npm 6.14.11
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 13.3.12
... animations, common, compiler, core, forms, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1303.10
@angular-devkit/build-angular   13.3.5
@angular-devkit/core            13.3.10
@angular-devkit/schematics      13.3.5
@angular/cdk                    13.3.9
@angular/cli                    13.3.5
@angular/compiler-cli           13.3.8
@angular/language-service       13.3.8
@schematics/angular             13.3.5
rxjs                            7.5.7
typescript                      4.6.4
```

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler): drop obsolete NgFactory and NgSummary config options
Issues.Body:
The options to generate NgFactory and NgSummary files were added to Ivy for backwards compatibility with ViewEngine. Since ViewEngine was deprecated and removed, the NgFactory and NgSummary files are no longer used as well.

This commit drops obsolete options to generate NgFactory and NgSummary files. Also, the logic that generates those files is also removed.

Issues.Title: alternatives to change TestBed configurations without creating the test.ts files
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

with Angular 15, now the `test.ts` file doesn't get generated by default, so it's not an easy task to change the `TestBed` configurations for example to enable `errorOnUnknownElements`
it will also be nice if we can change the pattern of the tests

### Proposed solution

to add the configurations inside the `angular.json` files in the options section of test

something like

```
"options": {
  "polyfills": [
    "zone.js",
    "zone.js/testing"
  ],
  "tsConfig": "tsconfig.spec.json",
  "inlineStyleLanguage": "scss",
  "assets": [
    "src/favicon.ico",
    "src/assets"
  ],
  "styles": [
    "src/styles.scss"
  ],
  "scripts": [],
  "errorOnUnknownElements": true,      <--- 
  "errorOnUnknownProperties": true,    <--- 
  "pattern": "\.custom-spec\.ts$"      <--- 
}
```

### Alternatives considered

to be able to enable them globally from any script (to create a js file and add it to the scripts of the test) with something like

```
getTestBed().setoptions({
  errorOnUnknownElements: true,
  errorOnUnknownProperties: true,
  pattern: /\.custom-spec\.ts$/
});
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "alternatives to change TestBed configurations without creating the test.ts files" (#24345)

Issues.Title: Browserslist unique for each project
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Description

An Angular project with some shared functionality between multiple front-end applications (ex. `./projects/full-client` and `./projects/lite-client`) currently needs to be built via lowest common denominator. The "lite" client is targeting older browsers (like IE11, for example) while the "full" client targets evergreen browsers.

As it stands now, the root `.browserslistrc` file needs to include `ie11` in the list of supported browsers so the "lite" client will compile properly, but that forces the "full" client to compile for IE11 as well.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Each project folder should be able to specify their own `.browserslistrc` file that overrides a root-level one.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

We've moved shared functionality to a stand-alone library project, and the two front-ends are separate Angular projects. We'd love to be able to put all three of these under a single project folder and have `npm run build` just work.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Browserslist unique for each project" (#24339)

Issues.Title: 'update' command using the last stable version introduces unnecessary node version requirements
Issues.Body:
### Command

update

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

If I try to run the `ng update` command with an old local version of the CLI, the CLI attempts to first acquire the 'latest stable version' before running `ng update`.

This creates a requirement for my environment to meet the dependencies of the latest version of the CLI.

This is a problem in some cases if the environment in question is locked to the needs of the version we're targetting. In this case, I'm targeting an update to ng11. However, ng15 requires node ^14.20. 

In the enterprise environment I'm working on we only have certain authorized node versions, none of which are ^14.20.

It seems undesirable to force a user of the CLI to update their environment to use higher versions than the dependencies of the Angular version they wish to update to. 



### Minimal Reproduction

- Have old CLI installed locally (e.g. cli@10.0)
- Have node version < 14.20 loaded 
- run `ng update @angular/core@11.0`
- See error requiring Node ^14.20

### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
Sorry I can't share this as it's private
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

I'm building a library with the angular-cli and export an array of standalone components:

export const libImports = [FooComponent, BarComponent]

import { libImports } from '@mylib/name';

Value at position 4 in the AppComponent.imports of AppComponent is not a class

 export declare const libImports: (typeof FooComponent | typeof BarComponent)[];

      "title": "Improper Verification of Cryptographic Signature in node-forge",
      "npm_advisory_id": null,
      "overview": "### Impact\n\nRSA PKCS#1 v1.5 signature verification code does not check for tailing garbage bytes after decoding a `DigestInfo` ASN.1 structure.       "overview": "### Impact\n\nRSA PKCS#1 v1.5 signature verification code is lenient in checking the digest algorithm structure. Issues.Title: docs-bug(MatDialog): Document standalone import
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

TLDR; would be nice to document how to provide dialog and snackbar for standalone components.
I don't want to provide MatDialogModule for every standalone component that uses a dialog.

I guess I could add it to main.ts. I have a convenience service that does alert(), confirm(), error() dialogs and hides the MatDialogModule from simple components. I don't have a great way of providing MatDialogModule for this convenience service.

in the [docs](https://material.angular.io/components/dialog/api) it says:

`import {MatDialogModule} from '@angular/material/dialog';`

now that i'm using standalone components,
is it recommend to use:
`importProvidersFrom(MatDialogModule),`
in main.ts

e.g.

```bootstrapApplication(AppComponent, {
  providers: [
    // https://this-is-angular.github.io/angular-guides/docs/standalone-apis/configuring-the-router-using-standalone-features
    provideRouter(
      routes,
      withDebugTracing()),
    importProvidersFrom(HttpClientModule),
    importProvidersFrom(MatDialogModule),
    provideAnimations(),
  ]
}).catch(err => console.error(err));```

I guess it wouldn't make sense to provide MatDialogModule to the convenience service separately to how I provide it to some standalone components, as then perhaps the app would have inconsistent dialogs, so in main.ts makes sense, just feels disorganised.

### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/components/dialog/api
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(MatDialog): Document standalone import" (#26124)

Issues.Title: bug(form-field outline, v15 mdc, RTL): Wrong outline color in RTL when form-field input is disabled/focused
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression? - [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in v14 ## Description Notice how the outline of a disabled datepicker with `dir="rtl"` isn't fully grayed out: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5672108/204502634-7d8bfc56-aaeb-4879-8a6d-e34a282f3569.png) The issue also affects regular form-fields with disabled `` / ``. ## Cause In LTR, the disabled border-color is set after the border-left property, so it works fine, but in RTL, they are set in opposite order (perhaps due to higher specificity of the CSS rule), causing the border-right property to override border-color. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5672108/204504953-e6b6d8db-b3b7-4346-8ab3-dd5fa47101da.png) ## Suggested solution Consider replacing `border-right: 1px solid;` with individual properties to avoid implicitly setting `border-right-color` as part of `border-right`. I.e., consider replacing: ```scss [dir=rtl] .mdc-notched-outline__leading, .mdc-notched-outline__leading[dir=rtl] { border-right: 1px solid; <-- } ``` With: ```scss [dir=rtl] .mdc-notched-outline__leading, .mdc-notched-outline__leading[dir=rtl] { border-left: none; border-right-width: 1px; <-- border-right-style: solid; <-- } ``` (and similarly for the left side) ## Temporary workaround Global CSS: ```scss // Temporary workaround for bug https://github.com/angular/components/issues/26115. .mdc-text-field--disabled .mdc-notched-outline__leading, .mdc-text-field--disabled .mdc-notched-outline__trailing { border-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.06) !important; } ``` ## Reproduction 1. Angular Material v15 (mdc components) 2. dir="rtl" 3. `` 4. disabled input/select/datepicker ```html
``` ### Expected Behavior Gray outline. ### Actual Behavior Partially gray and partially black outline. ### Environment - Angular: `15.0.1` - CDK/Material: `15.0.0`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(form-field outline, v15 mdc, RTL): Wrong outline color in RTL when form-field input is disabled/focused" (#26115)

Issues.Title: bug(cdk Menu / Portal): Portal/Menu isAttached() not working in ShadowDOM
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When **CDK Menu** is placed in component inside **ShadowDom-encapsulated** component, the menu trigger _does_ open the menu, but _does not_ toggle it (when it's open then the click doesn't closes it).
I tracked the issue down through _cdk Menu -> overlayRef -> PortalOutlet -> isAttached()_

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Have ShadowDom component
2. Put Angular CDK Menu in this component
3. Try to toggle _cdkMenuTriggerFor_

### Expected Behavior

Should work same as when not in ShadowDom component.

### Actual Behavior

_cdkMenuTriggerFor_ inside ShadowDom doesn't toggle Menu.

Here is the stackblitz with reproducted bug:
**https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-rq5d9a?file=src/app/app.module.ts**

Stackblitz is ng 14, but this bug is still there in **Angular 15**.

### Environment

- Angular: 15^
- CDK/Material: 15^

Fixes #26107.

Issues.Title: help(Material theme): Adding theme colors from tailwind to palette
Issues.Body:
### What are you trying to do?

I would like to add the theme colors from tailwind's config file to the angular material theme palette using the theme() function from tailwind

### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

First tried by declaring a root variable (was using this approach in versions before 15)

```
:root{
   --primary-500:theme(colors.primary.500);
}
```

```
$mat-primary-palette: (
  50: #ffe7e6,
  100: #ffc4c1,
  200: #ff9d98,
  300: #ff766e,
  400: #ff584f,
  500: var(--primary-500),
 ```
 
 This creates the error on the npm start
 > ./src/styles.scss - Warning: Module Warning (from ./node_modules/sass-loader/dist/cjs.js):
var(--primary-500) is not a color. Falling back to "dark" tone.

  I also tried adding it straight to the palette
  ```
  $mat-primary-palette: (
  50: #ffe7e6,
  100: #ffc4c1,
  200: #ff9d98,
  300: #ff766e,
  400: #ff584f,
  500: theme(colors.primary.500),
 ```
 This shows an inline error
 
 > identifier or variable expectedscss(css-idorvarexpected)
  

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Install tailwind
2. Setup the config file


```
module.exports = {
  content: ["./src/**/*.{html,ts}", "./projects/**/*.{html,ts}"],
  theme: {
    extend: {
      colors: {
        contrast: {
          light: "#fffffff",
          dark: "#000000",
        },
        primary: {
          50: "#ffe7e6",
          100: "#ffc4c1",
          200: "#ff9d98",
          300: "#ff766e",
          400: "#ff584f",
          500: "#ff3b30",
          600: "#ff352b",
          700: "#ff2d24",
          800: "#ff261e",
          900: "#ff1913",
          A100: "#ffffff",
          A200: "#fffafa",
          A400: "#ffc8c7",
          A700: "#ffafad",
        },
        ```
        
3. Try add custom theme colors to material theme palette

### Environment

- Angular: 15
- CDK/Material: 15
- Browser(s): Chome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS

Issues.Title: bug(checkbox 15 (not legacy)): Checkbox "checked" not working properly after update to 15th version
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14 (for 15 it's also working for legacy-checkbox)

### Description

Checkbox changes own css-classes even if I have `event.preventDefault()` in (click) handler.
The issue is only for the checkbox (15), not for legacy-checkbox.

It sounds like not a critical issue, but it causes big problems in complex cases (e.g., when I change checkbox state through a ConfirmationDialog). 
It looks like: [checked] attr is changing, but checkbox is not rerendering (and ChangeDetectorRef cannot help too)

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create default app (Angular version - 15, AngularMaterial version - 15)
2. Import "new" Checkbox
`import { MatCheckboxModule } from '@angular/material/checkbox';`
3. Set (click) handler with one line inside: `event.preventDefault()`
4. Click on the checkbox

### Expected Behavior

Checkbox doesn't change self state (attr **and** styles/css-classes), if I have `event.preventDefault()`

### Actual Behavior

Checkbox CHANGES css-classes (it's not okay), but doesn't change state (it's okay)

I created two **sandboxes**:
**First one** - legacy-checkbox
https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-3657ht?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html,src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.ts,src%2Fapp%2Fmaterial-module.ts
**Second** - checkbox 15 
https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-wrcpmh?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html,src%2Fapp%2Fmaterial-module.ts

Also, I made **videos**
**Legacy** 
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/117910324/204268636-e51ac1c0-f971-4bf0-9759-9497c1c95543.mp4
**15** 
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/117910324/204268673-79fb902f-a36f-438e-bdd4-1d91a57ccdd5.mp4



### Environment

- Angular: 15.0.1
- CDK/Material: 15.0.0
- Browser(s): Google Chrome all versions
- Operating System macOS Ventura 13.0.1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(checkbox 15 (not legacy)): Checkbox "checked" not working properly after update to 15th version" (#26100)

Issues.Title: bug(Input): Input of type="time" doesn't have icon and drop-down anymore
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.2.7

### Description

`<input matInput type="time">` presents differently in version15.0.0 and does not show the clock icon anymore. Therefore the drop-down to pick a time can no longer be accessed. The time can only be entered via number keys:
![input-timeV15](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67003614/204251137-ab1e149f-16f2-43d2-98a5-3949233cf3ef.PNG)

Previous version:
![input-timeV14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67003614/204251213-e429174d-105e-4058-a450-339a442d0387.PNG)


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. set type of input to time: 
`<form class="example-form">`
 ` <mat-form-field class="example-full-width">`
    `<mat-label>Pick a time</mat-label>`
    `<input matInput type="time"/>`
  `</mat-form-field>`
`</form>`


### Expected Behavior

Input field shows clock icon and drop-down can be accessed to pick a time via mouse click.

### Actual Behavior

Time can only be entered via number keys.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.0.0
- CDK/Material: 15.0.0
- Browser(s): Edge, Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(Input): Input of type="time" doesn't have icon and drop-down anymore" (#26099)
